page.title: 16GODSHILL PARK HOUSE
page.content: Built circa 1740 as a home farm of Appuldurcombe Estate, it was remodelled about 1840 and extended to become a gentleman's residence. Built of local stone, with Georgian sash windows, the original roof has hand made clay peg tiles. About 1900 a servants' wing was added, the later addition having a welsh slate roof, 10 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, lounge, dining room, study, billiard room, kitchen and servants' hall. The 4-acre grounds contained fish ponds, fountains, walled garden, orchard, stables, keenels and coach house. Pre-1939 it was a guest house,then successively an emergency army hostel and a hostel for Italian prisoner of war working on the land. Bomb damaged and empty for several years, it is now restored as a family home.
